revised_title: Investigation of Flame Spectra in Open-hearth and Bessemer Processes
tldr: This study investigates the spectra of flames resulting from the open-hearth and Bessemer processes, identifying new lines and bands in the Bessemer flame spectra. The authors analyze the chemical composition of various materials involved in the processes and provide insights into the chemistry of the Bessemer process. They also compare the spectra from open-hearth and cupola furnaces, finding that line spectra are not observed in open-hearth flames due to the oxidizing atmosphere of the furnace.
